Course_Name: [SoSe 2024] How will we work and live together?

Messages.Author: Philip Stillke
Messages.Content: Dear Students, everyone has to register for the exam over the TU platform Moses. The presentation on Tuesday the 16th of July is the exam. For those who are exchange students it is the same.  With that registration we can prepare a certificate for your university back home.  https://moseskonto.tu-berlin.de/ So far three students are registered. So it works : ) For the Master Typology Students it is: Modul 61111 Designstudio 1 For the Master Architecture Students it is: Modul 60352 Entwurfsprojekt Hochbau I Best Philip

Messages.Author: Philip Stillke
Messages.Content: Dear Students, on the 20th we will start at 9:30 am with an input about requirements and design of facades. From 10:30 am we will have Designmeetings. Please choose a time slot here.  https://isis.tu-berlin.de/mod/choice/view.php?id=1843690 For those who have to travel back home to Italy for an exam. You can use this zoom link.  Please write either Miryam or me when you have booked the timeslot.  https://tu-berlin.zoom.us/j/69944412584?pwd=V3l6bW12bDByOHZNOHZsKy9EUHY5QT09 Best Miryam and Philip  Heinricht Zille (that illustrator that captured live in Berlin 100 years ago)  https://www.art-prints-on-demand.com/a/zille-heinrich.html http://zillemuseum-berlin.com/

Messages.Author: Philip Stillke
Messages.Content: Dear Students, please find here the ID template for the exhibition catalogue.  This is to further spark interest in your designs and our happening on the 31st of July inside the Belgienhalle. https://tubcloud.tu-berlin.de/s/zXyFRNRcBmHiFEJ You can be playful with your layout here: use the font you like, pictures of the modell, the most elaborate drawing,  pictures of what you produce, be minimal, be maximal ...it is about teasing : )  I placed some "inspiration" next to the template.  In the top right corner you find the axonometry from the Belgienhalle. Please place the polygon according to your position inside the hall. Please upload the pdf in that directory next to the template folder by Tuesday. We would like to discuss this with UTB on Wednesday and than further send it to news papers etc.  Best Miryam and Philip

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Correct Link Miro - Daytrip and Exhibition

Messages.Author: Philip Stillke
Messages.Content: Dear Students, please find the correct link for the Miro here. There is no list for Thursday and the Gipsformerei necessary. Please fill in the list for the daytrip to Dessau and the list for the exhibition at the Belgienhalle. We have booked a guided tour at the Bauhaus, which we need to confirm. Best Philip https://miro.com/welcomeonboard/RGFQb2M4ZFZuZ0QzTXhVT3RKemRXTFZKdHNaeGFYV21vamUwaHdBTTg4ZHdyZnZFNXVNdkVEMGRpQjVGbW9YR3wzNDU4NzY0NTQ0NTE4NDg5NzMzfDI=?share_link_id=13422260891

Messages.Author: Philip Stillke
Messages.Content: Dear Students, this Thursday we meet at 9 am at the Gipsformerei here. https://maps.app.goo.gl/yRU1dvf1xqHP62HB6 Afterwards we meet in the studio and have designmeeting. We don´t quite know when we will be back so we will do it without time slots.  The facade input will be on the 20th.  This week let us talk about your "focus and detail area". This can be interior or an intervention with the existing structure. How is this or that detail representative for your schematic design and architectural intention? Bring a first graphic and frame of what you want to focus.  We also want to recap with you the feedback you have received and sketch out a strategy how to integrate it. How to increase the level of integration of your design? How can you complement your neighbors within the hall? Important: Please find here the link to a miroboard which we will use to organize the daytrip and the exhibition. Please fill in your names quickly in the list. So we know how many people will join to make reservations etc. and book a tour.  https://miro.com/welcomeonboard/RGFQb2M4ZFZuZ0QzTXhVT3RKemRXTFZKdHNaeGFYV21vamUwaHdBTTg4ZHdyZnZFNXVNdkVEMGRpQjVGbW9YR3wzNDU4NzY0NTQ0NTE4NDg5NzMzfDI=?share_link_id=267016839132 looking forward Miryam and Philip

Messages.Author: Philip Stillke
Messages.Content: Dear Students, please find the link to upload you presentation for today. Best Philip https://tubcloud.tu-berlin.de/s/BnDx27jN6dJdRne

Messages.Author: Philip Stillke
Messages.Content: Dear Students, we think that you showed us very interesting ideas and concepts at the intermediate presentation : ) Let us now set up the upcoming weeks so it is fun and productive.  Next week we will start at 9am with an input by Miry about the workshop Gipsformerei which we will visit the week after. At 10am Mr. Warnke from the UTB will be there to give you feedback.  We will have time with him for about 2 hours.  Each group has about just five minutes to very briefly present the status of the design.  Please prepare a pdf. presentation with about eight slides and load it in our upload folder here.   https://tubcloud.tu-berlin.de/s/BnDx27jN6dJdRne At noon we will talk about organisation such as our daytrip and the remaining weeks of the studio.  At 3pm we will be one more time at the Belgienhalle. There we will discuss the detail and focus point of your design and intervention with the existing structure..."How to integrate the new window, gate etc"  We are looking forward Miry and Philip

Messages.Author: Philip Stillke
Messages.Content: Dear Students, we will start with the presentations this Thursday 10am. Please put up your A0 poster beforehand. For your presentation you will use your own device to connect to the projector.  The presenting order will be roughly the position in the Belgienhalle. Each group has about 10-15 minutes to present their design. Then there are 10 min for questions and feedback from us.  We are looking very much forward to your presentation.  You find the deliverables in the cloud here: https://tubcloud.tu-berlin.de/apps/files/?dir=/Shared/gte_member/gte_Lehre-aktuell/gte_24_SS_Studio/Belgienhalle/planning%20basis%20for%20students/00_design%20brief%20and%20schedule&fileid=3939197527 Best Philip

Messages.Author: Philip Stillke
Messages.Content: Dear Students, please find a table summarizing our conversation about the location of each workshop in the cloud here. https://tubcloud.tu-berlin.de/s/BwPaAfiFAPDC7mS I think we found two options that work fine and everyone can anticipate now where the workshop is located. I think this going in the right direction in terms of work together. You will also find the list for the deliverables we showed you today. It is only an orientation for the intermediate presentation.   For next week we highly recommend to work on the axonometries and spatial concept for the tower and workshop. Prepare a sequence of slides that explains how you organized your workshop. What are the architectural qualities? This is now the time to try out a lot of options and to avoid path dependency.   You can choose a time slot for the designmeeting next week already. Miry is not in Berlin but is offering you feedback over zoom. Best Miry and Philip https://isis.tu-berlin.de/mod/choice/view.php?id=1833901 Zoom link Miry https://tu-berlin.zoom.us/j/69944412584?pwd=V3l6bW12bDByOHZNOHZsKy9EUHY5QT09

Messages.Author: Philip Stillke
Messages.Content: Dear Students, this Thursday Heiko from the Workshop is giving us a tour and little input at 10:30 am. Before and after there are time slots you can choose for your designmeeting.  Focus will be the spatial program and integration in your compartment and physical model.  Attached you will also find the updated schedule with our trip to Dessau and the site visit Gipsformerei.  Best Miry and Philip  time slots:  https://isis.tu-berlin.de/mod/choice/view.php?id=1832627&forceview=1

Messages.Author: Philip Stillke
Messages.Content: Dear Students, we are starting tomorrow at 10 am with a little input from my side. Please remember that at 3 pm there is an opportunity to get into the Belgienhalle one more time. kind regards  Philip

Messages.Author: Philip Stillke
Messages.Content: Dear Students, please find in the cloud an updated schedule. We will have a look on it on Thursday.  https://tubcloud.tu-berlin.de/s/BwPaAfiFAPDC7mS For our gathering this Thursday we suggest 5:30pm at the beergarden Zollpackhof. It is central, by the water and outside so we can enjoy the nice wheater.  Food is not so great but overall convenience wins here. https://maps.app.goo.gl/Ubf97JYKYrTvxezh7 We are looking forward to your analysis and ideas about what to produce. kind regards Miry and Philip  M.Sc. Philip Stillke, Architekt Wissenschaftlicher Mitarbeiter GTE  I  Gebäudetechnik und Entwerfen  Technische Universitaet Berlin Fakultaet VI Planen Bauen Umwelt Institut fuer Architektur Fachgebiet Gebäudetechnik und Entwerfen  Strasse des 17. Juni 152 D-10623 Berlin      Germany  stillke@tu-berlin.de

Messages.Author: Philip Stillke
Messages.Content: Dear Students, here are some information for the presentation of the analysis next Thursday. We have a full day next week. Each group is presenting for about 10 min their topic. Then we will have for about 5 - 10 min for questions and comments. Your aim is to get across how your topic might effect the schematic design. It is all about overviews. What are the key components?  deliverables  Digital presentation with your own computer device via projector. Upload poster as pdf. Print out A1. (portrait format, one or two posters)  The model group does not need a presentation or poster although they can show the files they used and highlight certain measurements.  Within your "planning basis for students" cloud folder is now an "upload folder". You can upload and edit files in this folder. After the presentation we will sort the files in the fixed file structure. You will find there a folder called "analysis inspiration". This is from another studio. Just as a little inspiration for graphics and scope. Also there is a "pictures site visit" folder. You may upload your pictures so we have a pool for us all. https://tubcloud.tu-berlin.de/s/2EnLPi4djKdmRjR More information regarding our social happening and workshop courses will follow : ) We are looking forward to your analysis Best Miry and Philip M.Sc. Philip Stillke, Architekt Wissenschaftlicher Mitarbeiter GTE  I  Gebäudetechnik und Entwerfen  Technische Universitaet Berlin Fakultaet VI Planen Bauen Umwelt Institut fuer Architektur Fachgebiet Gebäudetechnik und Entwerfen  Strasse des 17. Juni 152 D-10623 Berlin      Germany  stillke@tu-berlin.de

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Welcome to the ISIS course of How will we work and live together?

Messages.Author: Philip Stillke
Messages.Content: Dear Students, welcome to the ISIS course of How will we work and live together?. We will use ISIS for announcements and general information about designmeetings, the schedule or submissions deliveries etc. We will reduce updates to a minimum but we assume that you have read them carefully.  For individual questions please write me an Email.  If you have not received a notification for this topic please adjust your settings. Please ask your group member if they have received the notification via mail.  Best Miry and Philip M.Sc. Philip Stillke, Architekt Wissenschaftlicher Mitarbeiter GTE  I  Gebäudetechnik und Entwerfen  Technische Universitaet Berlin Fakultaet VI Planen Bauen Umwelt Institut fuer Architektur Fachgebiet Gebäudetechnik und Entwerfen  Strasse des 17. Juni 152 D-10623 Berlin      Germany  stillke@tu-berlin.de
